member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.BaseLicenseDetector
member.summary: Define a class for detecting license.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.BaseLicenseDetector.#ctor
member.summary: The constructor.

summary.para: Provides static methods that should be called from the constructors of licensed classes.
Also provides a static method that can be called to show the about box with product and licensing information.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: Check the ShouldNag property of the returned to determine whether the licensed class should nag the user. This value is set to true in situations where a valid license was not found but a nag dialog could not be displayed. In these cases, the licensed class is supposed to nag in some other way (with a watermark for example).

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform license validation. Call this method from the licensed object's constructor to save a license key at design time, validate it at runtime, and display a nag dialog if a valid license is not found.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Reference to the licensed object (not currently used).
Whether the nag dialog should be displayed when a valid license is not found.
member.returns: A object that contains information about the license.

remarks.para: This overload was created for use in WPF. It should be called in the control's constructor in order to support license persistence correctly. But it should not show the nag dialog until the control is fully loaded, or the VS designer may remain blank.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Nag(System.Type,C1.Util.Licensing.LicenseInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Nag user by showing AboutBox with license information. Show it only once per day per assembly.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
object that contains information about the license.
Whether we're running at design or run time.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.Validate(System.Type,System.Object,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Version of Validate used by constructors that take runtime keys.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
Assembly that contains the owner licensed control.
member.returns: A with information about the runtime key.

remarks.para: This allows a licensed C1 class to create other C1 objects bypassing license verification for the child objects.
For extra safety, we check that the owner object is defined in an assembly the contains a 'C1ProductInfo' attribute.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.ValidateDesigntime(System.Type,System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext)
member.summary: Design time validation. Looks for a license in the registry and saves it in the provided .
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
where the runtime key will be stored.
member.returns: A with information about the license.
member.remarks: Call this method from application-type products (that always require a license to be installed in the registry). In this case, the parameter should be set to null.

member.name: M:C1.Util.Licensing.ProviderInfo.ValidateRuntime(System.Type,System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext)
member.summary: Runtime validation. Looks for a runtime key stored in the current application's resources.
member.param: Type of licensed object (use typeof() and not GetType()).
where the runtime key will be stored.
member.returns: A with information about the license.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.SafeLicenseContext
member.summary:
Provides a version of GetSavedLicenseKey that doesn't require special permissions.
The code was mostly copied from the .NET framework, but then changed in a few places to require fewer permissions (assembly name, file io, etc).
The main change is the use of a custom deserializer to read Hashtable objects instead of the original BinaryFormatter, which requires permissions.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.C1AboutNameAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to specify the product name shown on the About Box.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.C1ProductInfoAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to attach licensing/product information to assemblies.

member.name: T:C1.Util.Licensing.ProductLicense
member.summary:
Represents a license for a product (e.g. C1BarCode, C1Studio Enterprise).
Provides methods for: - generating new license keys (administrative task) - checking license key validity (used by installer and products) - generating and checking runtime keys (used by products) - installing/uninstalling licenses (used by installer)
The install/uninstall code requires elevated permissions, and is used only by setups and utilities (not by controls). The code is implemented in the ProductLicense.Installer.cs, which controls should not include since it won't be useful to them.
When a product is sold, we send the user a license KEY. The user installs a license on his machine by providing his name, his company name, and the key.
The is a string in the following format:
AAQYYCC-XX-NNNNNN-DD-DZZZZZZ
Where:
AA: Product code (should match one of the products in the product catalog (see ProductInformation.GetProductCatalog()). Q: Quarter when the license key was issued (1, 2, or 3) YY: Year when the license key was issued (e.g., 10 for 2010) CC: Order code, two chars that indicate whether this is a new sale, upgrade, renewal, special offer, etc. XX: Hash code to ensure key validity. NNNNNN: Unique serial number. DDD: Vendor code, three chars ZZZZZZ: Combination of random numbers for uniqueness and extra hash.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeMap`1
member.summary: It displays hierarchical (tree-structured) data as a set of nested rectangles.
member.remarks: Each branch of the tree is given a rectangle, which is then tiled with smaller rectangles representing sub-branches. A leaf node's rectangle has an area proportional to a specified dimension of the data. Often the leaf nodes are colored to show a separate dimension of the data.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Mvc.AutoComplete`1
member.summary: The AutoComplete control is an input control that allows callers to customize the item list as the user types.
member.remarks: The control is similar to the ComboBox, except the item source is a function (ItemsSourceFunction) rather than a static list. For example, you can look up items on remote databases as the user types.

member.remarks: This property is useful when styling the drop-down element, because it is shown as a child of the document body rather than as a child of the control itself, which prevents using CSS selectors based on the parent control.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum height of the drop-down list.

member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the template used to generate each list item.

member.summary: Occurs when the value of the SelectedIndex property changes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the content of the template used to generate each list item.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ComboBoxBase`1.HeaderPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of a property to use for getting the value displayed in the control's input element.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is null, which causes the control to display the same content in the input element as in the selected item of the drop-down list. Use this property if you want to de-couple the value shown in the input element from the values shown in the drop-down list. For example, the input element could show an item's name and the drop-down list could show additional detail.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the CSS class used to highlight any parts of the content that match the search terms.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to null, which causes the matching terms to be shown in bold. You can set it to the name of a CSS class to change the way the matches are displayed.

member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing a comma-separated list of properties to use when searching for items.
member.remarks: By default, the AutoComplete control searches for matches against the property specified by the DisplayMemberPath property. The searchMemberPath property allows you to search using additional properties.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the control value must be set to a non-null value or whether it can be set to null (by deleting the content of the control).

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Gauge.TickSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing between tickmarks.
member.remarks: Set the ShowTicks property to true if you want the gauge to show tickmarks along its face. By default, the interval between tickmarks is defined by the Step property. Use the TickSpacing property to override the default and use a spacing that is different from the Step value. Set the TickSpacing property to null to revert to the default behavior.

member.summary: Gets or sets the latest date that the user can select in the calendar.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Calendar.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the first day of the week, the one displayed in the first column of the calendar.
member.remarks: Setting this property to null causes the calendar to use the default for the current culture. In the English culture, the first day of the week is Sunday; in most European cultures, the first day of the week is Monday.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Calendar.ItemFormatter
member.summary: Gets or sets a formatter function to customize dates in the calendar.
member.remarks: The formatter function can add any content and any date. It allows complete customization of the appearance and behavior of the calendar.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Calendar.OnClientValueChanged
member.summary: Occurs after a new date is selected.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Calendar.OnClientDisplayMonthChanged
member.summary: Occurs after the DisplayMonth property changes.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Calendar.ItemValidator
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of a validator javascript function to determine whether dates are valid for selection.
member.remarks: If specified, the validator function should take one parameter representing the date to be tested, and should return false if the date is invalid and should not be selectable.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Calendar.OnClientFormatItem
member.summary: Occurs when an element representing a day in the calendar has been created.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Calendar.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user can modify the control value using the mouse and keyboard.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether users can select days, months, or no values at all.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Calendar.FormatDayHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets the format used to display the headers above the days in month view.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is 'ddd'.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Calendar.FormatDays
member.summary: Gets or sets the format used to display the days in month view.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is 'd ' (the space after the 'd' prevents the format from being interpreted as 'd', the standard format used to represent the short date pattern).

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Calendar.FormatMonths
member.summary: Gets or sets the format used to display the months in year view.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is 'MMM'.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Calendar.FormatYear
member.summary: Gets or sets the format used to display the year above the months in year view.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is 'yyyy'.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Calendar.FormatYearMonth
member.summary: Gets or sets the format used to display the month and year above the calendar in month view.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is 'y'.

member.summary: Occurs when the grid finishes creating/updating the elements that make up the current view.

The grid updates the view in response to several actions, including:
refreshing the grid or its data source,
adding, removing, or changing rows or columns,
resizing or scrolling the grid,
changing the selection.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexGridBase`1.CloneFrozenCells
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the FlexGrid should clone frozen cells and show them in a separate element to improve perceived performance while scrolling.
member.remarks: This property is set to null by default, which causes the grid to select the best setting depending on the browser.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexGridBase`1.ItemValidator
member.summary: Gets or sets a validator function to determine whether cells contain valid data.
member.remarks: If specified, the validator function should take two parameters containing the cell's row and column indices, and should return a string containing the error description. This property is especially useful when dealing with unbound grids, since bound grids can be validated using the property instead.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexGridBase`1.KeyActionEnter
member.summary: Gets or sets the action to perform when the ENTER key is pressed.
member.remarks: The default setting for this property is , which causes the control to move the selection to the next row. This is the standard Excel behavior.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexGridBase`1.KeyActionTab
member.summary: Gets or sets the action to perform when the TAB key is pressed.
member.remarks: The default setting for this property is , which causes the browser to select the next or previous controls on the page when the TAB key is pressed. This is the recommended setting to improve page accessibility. In previous versions, the default was set to , which caused the control to move the selection across and down he grid. This is the standard Excel behavior, but is not good for accessibility.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexGridBase`1.RowHeaderPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property used to create row header cells.
member.remarks: Row header cells are not visible or selectable. They are meant for use with accessibility tools.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexPie`1
member.summary: The FlexPie control provides pie and doughnut charts with selectable slices.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexPieBase`1
member.summary: The base class of flex pie.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexPieBase`1.#ctor(System.Web.Mvc.HtmlHelper,System.String)
member.summary: Creates one instance.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexPieBase`1.BindingName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property that contains the name of the data item.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexPieBase`1.InnerRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the pie's inner radius.
member.remarks: The inner radius is measured as a fraction of the pie radius. The default value for this property is zero, which creates a pie. Setting this property to values greater than zero creates pies with a hole in the middle, also known as doughnut charts.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexPieBase`1.IsAnimated
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use animation when items are selected.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexPieBase`1.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset of the slices from the pie center.
member.remarks: The offset is measured as a fraction of the pie radius.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexPieBase`1.Reversed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether angles are reversed (counter-clockwise).
member.remarks: The default value is false, which causes angles to be measured in the clockwise direction.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexPieBase`1.SelectedItemOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset of the selected slice from the pie center.
member.remarks: Offsets are measured as a fraction of the pie radius.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexPieBase`1.SelectedItemPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the selected slice.
member.remarks: Setting this property to a value other than 'None' causes the pie to rotate when an item is selected. Note that in order to select slices by clicking the chart, you must set theselectionMode property to "Point".

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexPieBase`1.StartAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting angle for the pie slices, in degrees.
member.remarks: Angles are measured clockwise, starting at the 9 o'clock position.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexPieBase`1.DataLabel
member.summary: Gets the style of point data label.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.FlexPieBase`1.SelectedIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the selected slice.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property that contains the chart values.

member.summary: Creates one instance.

member.summary: Gets or sets the format string used to create the header content when the control has more than MaxHeaderItems items checked.
member.remarks: The format string may contain the '{count}' replacement string which gets replaced with the number of items currently checked. The default value for this property in the English culture is '{count:n0} items selected'.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.MultiSelect`1.HeaderFormatter
member.summary: Gets or sets a function that gets the HTML in the control header.
member.remarks: By default, the control header content is determined based on the Placeholder, MaxHeaderItems, and on the current selection. You may customize the header content by specifying a function that returns a custom string based on whatever criteria your application requires.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.MultiSelect`1.MaxHeaderItems
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of items to display on the control header.
member.remarks: If no items are selected, the header displays the text specified by the Placeholder property.If the number of selected items is smaller than or equal to the value of the MaxHeaderItems property, the selected items are shown in the header. If the number of selected items is greater than MaxHeaderItems, the header displays the selected item count instead.

member.summary: Creates one instance.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Popup.RenderContent(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Renders content of control.
member.param: The specified writer used to write the markup.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Popup.Owner
member.summary: Gets or sets the selector string to determine the element that own this popup.
member.remarks: If the Owner is null or invalidate, the Popup behaves like a dialog. It is centered on the screen and must be shown using the client show method.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Popup.FadeIn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether popups should be shown using a fade-in animation.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Popup.FadeOut
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether popups should be hidden using a fade-out animation.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Popup.Modal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the Popup should be displayed as a modal dialog.
member.remarks: Modal dialogs show a dark backdrop that makes the Popup stand out from other content on the page.If you want to make a dialog truly modal, also set the HideTrigger property to None, so users won't be able to click the backdrop to dismiss the dialog. In this case, the dialog will close only if the close method is called or if the user presses the Escape key.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Popup.HideTrigger
member.summary: Gets or sets the actions that hide the Popup.
member.remarks: By default, the HideTrigger property is set to Blur, which hides the popup when it loses focus.If you set the HideTrigger property to Click, the popup will be hidden only when the owner element is clicked.If you set the HideTrigger property to None, the popup will be hidden only when the hide method is called.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Popup.ShowTrigger
member.summary: Gets or sets the actions that show the Popup.
member.remarks: By default, the ShowTrigger property is set to Click, which causes the popup to appear when the user clicks the owner element.If you set the ShowTrigger property to None, the popup will be shown only when the show method is called.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Popup.OnClientHiding
member.summary: Gets or sets the client function which occurs before the Popup is hiding.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.Popup.OnClientHidden
member.summary: Gets or sets the client function which occurs after the Popup has been hidden.

member.summary: Gets or sets the client function which occurs before the Popup is showing.

member.summary: Gets or sets the client function which occurs after the Popup has been shown.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.ShowCheckboxes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the control should add checkboxes to nodes and manage their state. This property can be used only on trees without lazy-loaded nodes(LazyLoadFunction is not set and IsLazyLoading is false).

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.AutoCollapse
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if sibling nodes should be collapsed when a node is expanded.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.IsAnimated
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to use animations when expanding or collapsing nodes.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether users can edit the text in the nodes. When it is set to false, users may edit the content of the tree nodes by typing directly into the nodes. The F2 key can also be used to enter edit mode with the whole node content selected.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.AllowDragging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether users can drag and drop nodes within the control.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.ExpandOnClick
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether to expand collapsed nodes when the user clicks the node header.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.LazyLoadFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets a client function that loads child nodes on demand.
member.remarks: It takes two parameters: the node being and a callback to be invoked when the data becomes available. The callback function tells the that the node loading process has been completed. It should always be called, even if there are errors when loading the data.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientItemsSourceChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the value of the ItemsSource property changes.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientLoadingItems
member.summary: Occurs before the tree items are generated.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientLoadedItems
member.summary: Occurs after the tree items have been generated.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientItemClicked
member.summary: Occurs when the user clicks an item or presses the Enter key and an item is selected.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientSelectedItemChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the selected item is changes.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientCheckedItemsChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the checked items are changed.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientIsCollapsedChanging
member.summary: Occurs before a node is collapsed or expanded.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientIsCollapsedChanged
member.summary: Occurs after a node is collapsed or expanded.

member.summary: Occurs before the check status of a node is changed.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientIsCheckedChanged
member.summary: Occurs after the check status of a node is changed.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientFormatItem
member.summary: Occurs when an element representing a node has been created.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientDragStart
member.summary: Occurs when the user starts dragging a node. This event only occurs if the AllowDrag property is set to true.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientDragOver
member.summary: Occurs while the user drags a node over other nodes on the .
member.remarks: Returns true if the event is not cancelled.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientDrop
member.summary: Occurs when the user drops a on the .
member.remarks: Returns true if the event is not cancelled.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientDragEnd
member.summary: Occurs when the user finishes a drag/drop operation, either by dropping a node into a new location or by canceling the operation with the mouse or keyboard.

member.summary: Occurs before a node enters edit mode.

member.summary: Occurs after a node has entered edit mode.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientNodeEditEnding
member.summary: Occurs before a node exits edit mode.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.TreeView.OnClientNodeEditEnded
member.summary: Occurs after a node has exited edit mode.

refreshing the grid or its data source,
adding, removing, or changing rows or columns,
resizing or scrolling the grid,
changing the selection.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.FlexGridBaseBuilder`3.CloneFrozenCells(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Configurates . Sets a value that determines whether the FlexGrid should clone frozen cells and show them in a separate element to improve perceived performance while scrolling.
member.remarks: This property is set to null by default, which causes the grid to select the best setting depending on the browser.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.FlexGridBaseBuilder`3.ItemValidator(System.String)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets a validator function to determine whether cells contain valid data.
member.remarks: If specified, the validator function should take two parameters containing the cell's row and column indices, and should return a string containing the error description. This property is especially useful when dealing with unbound grids, since bound grids can be validated using the property instead.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.FlexGridBaseBuilder`3.KeyActionEnter(C1.Web.Mvc.Grid.KeyAction)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets the action to perform when the ENTER key is pressed.
member.remarks: The default setting for this property is , which causes the control to move the selection to the next row. This is the standard Excel behavior.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.FlexGridBaseBuilder`3.KeyActionTab(C1.Web.Mvc.Grid.KeyAction)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets the action to perform when the TAB key is pressed.
member.remarks: The default setting for this property is , which causes the browser to select the next or previous controls on the page when the TAB key is pressed. This is the recommended setting to improve page accessibility. In previous versions, the default was set to , which caused the control to move the selection across and down he grid. This is the standard Excel behavior, but is not good for accessibility.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.FlexGridBaseBuilder`3.RowHeaderPath(System.String)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets the name of the property used to create row header cells.
member.remarks: Row header cells are not visible or selectable. They are meant for use with accessibility tools.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.MultiSelectBuilder`1.HeaderFormatter(System.String)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets a function that gets the HTML in the control header.
member.remarks: By default, the control header content is determined based on the Placeholder, MaxHeaderItems, and on the current selection. You may customize the header content by specifying a function that returns a custom string based on whatever criteria your application requires.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.MultiSelectBuilder`1.MaxHeaderItems(System.Int32)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets the maximum number of items to display on the control header.
member.remarks: If no items are selected, the header displays the text specified by the Placeholder property.If the number of selected items is smaller than or equal to the value of the MaxHeaderItems property, the selected items are shown in the header. If the number of selected items is greater than MaxHeaderItems, the header displays the selected item count instead.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.PopupBuilder.Owner(System.String)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets the selector string to determine the element that own this popup.
member.remarks: If the Owner is null or invalidate, the Popup behaves like a dialog. It is centered on the screen and must be shown using the client show method.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.PopupBuilder.FadeIn(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets a value that determines whether popups should be shown using a fade-in animation.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.PopupBuilder.FadeOut(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets a value that determines whether popups should be hidden using a fade-out animation.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.PopupBuilder.Modal(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets a value that determines whether the Popup should be displayed as a modal dialog.
member.remarks: Modal dialogs show a dark backdrop that makes the Popup stand out from other content on the page.If you want to make a dialog truly modal, also set the HideTrigger property to None, so users won't be able to click the backdrop to dismiss the dialog. In this case, the dialog will close only if the close method is called or if the user presses the Escape key.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.PopupBuilder.HideTrigger(C1.Web.Mvc.PopupTrigger)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets the actions that hide the Popup.
member.remarks: By default, the HideTrigger property is set to Blur, which hides the popup when it loses focus.If you set the HideTrigger property to Click, the popup will be hidden only when the owner element is clicked.If you set the HideTrigger property to None, the popup will be hidden only when the hide method is called.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.PopupBuilder.ShowTrigger(C1.Web.Mvc.PopupTrigger)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets the actions that show the Popup.
member.remarks: By default, the ShowTrigger property is set to Click, which causes the popup to appear when the user clicks the owner element.If you set the ShowTrigger property to None, the popup will be shown only when the show method is called.

member.summary: Configurates . Sets a value that determines whether users can drag and drop nodes within the control.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.TreeViewBuilder.ExpandOnClick(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets a value that determines whether to expand collapsed nodes when the user clicks the node header.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.TreeViewBuilder.LazyLoadFunction(System.String)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets a client function that loads child nodes on demand.
member.remarks: It takes two parameters: the node being and a callback to be invoked when the data becomes available. The callback function tells the that the node loading process has been completed. It should always be called, even if there are errors when loading the data.

member.summary: Represents a column on the grid.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.#ctor
member.summary: Creates one instance.

member.summary: Creates one instance.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.ShouldSerializeDataMap
member.summary: Specifies whether the DataMap property should be serialized.
member.returns: If true, it will be serialized. Otherwise, it will not be serialized.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.AllowDragging
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the user can move this row or column to a new position with the mouse.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.AllowMerging
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cells in this row or column can be merged.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.AllowResizing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the user can resize the row or column with the mouse.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.CssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets a CSS class name to be used when rendering non-header cells in this row or column.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.IsContentHtml
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cells in this row or column contain HTML content rather than plain text.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cells in this row or column can be edited.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.IsSelected
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this row or column is selected.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this row or column is visible.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.WordWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cells in this row or column should wrap their content.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.Aggregate
member.summary: Gets or sets the Aggregate to display in the group header rows for this column.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.Align
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of items in this column.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is null, which causes the grid to select the alignment automatically based on column's dataType (numbers are right-aligned, boolean values are centered, other types are left-aligned).If you want to override the default alignment, set this property to 'left', 'right', or 'center'.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.AllowSorting
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the user can sort this column by clicking its header.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.Binding
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property this column is bound to.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.DataType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of value stored in this column.Values are coerced into the proper type when editing the grid.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string used to convert raw values into display values for this column (see Globalize).

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.Header
member.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed in the column header.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.InputType
member.summary: Gets or sets the "type" attribute of the HTML input element used to edit values in this column.
member.remarks: Use this property to change the default setting if the default does not work well for the current culture, device, or application.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets a mask to be used while editing values in this column.
member.remarks: The mask format is the same used by the InputMask control. If specified, the mask should be compatible with the value of the format property. For example, the mask '99/99/9999' can be used for entering dates formatted as 'MM/dd/yyyy'.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.MaxWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum width of this column.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.MinWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum width of this column.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this column.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.Required
member.summary: Deprecated: use IsRequired instead to avoid confusion with 'required' HTML attribute.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.IsRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether values in the column are required.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to null, which means values are required, but string columns may contain empty strings. When set to true, values are required and empty strings are not allowed. When set to false, null values and empty strings are allowed.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of this column.
member.remarks: Column widths may be positive numbers (column width in pixels), null or negative numbers (use the collection's default column width), or strings in the format '{number}*' (star sizing).

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.CellTemplate
member.summary: Gets the cell template in this column.
member.remarks: It only works for cells panel.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.SortMemberPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property to use when sorting this column.
member.remarks: Use this property in cases where you want the sorting to be performed based on values other than the ones speficied by the Binding property.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.DataMap
member.summary: Gets the DataMap used to convert raw values into display values for the column.
member.remarks: The drop-down buttons are shown only if the column has a DataMap set and is editable. Clicking on the drop-down buttons causes the grid to show a list where users can select the value for the cell.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.ShowDropDown
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the grid adds drop-down buttons to the cells in this column.
member.remarks: The drop-down buttons are shown only if the column has a DataMap set and is editable. Clicking on the drop-down buttons causes the grid to show a list where users can select the value for the cell.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ColumnBase.DropDownCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets a CSS class name to add to drop-downs in this column.
member.remarks: The drop-down buttons are shown only if the column has a DataMap set and is editable. Clicking on the drop-down buttons causes the grid to show a list where users can select the value for the cell. Cell drop-downs require the wijmo.input module to be loaded.

member.name: P:C1.Web.Mvc.ErrorBar`1.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the error value of the series. This property should be work with ErrorAmount property. If ErrorAmount is ErrorAmount.FixedValue, the Value property is a fixed number value. If ErrorAmount is ErrorAmount.Percentage, the Value property is a percentage number value between 0 and 1. If errorAmount is ErrorAmount.Custom, the Value property is an object of minus/plus value or an array of minus/plus value. If ErrorAmount is ErrorAmount.StandardDeviation, the Value property is a percentage number of calculated standard deviation value.

member.summary: Configurates . Sets a mask to be used while editing values in this column.
member.remarks: The mask format is the same used by the InputMask control. If specified, the mask should be compatible with the value of the format property. For example, the mask '99/99/9999' can be used for entering dates formatted as 'MM/dd/yyyy'.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.ColumnBaseBuilder`2.IsRequired(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Configurates . Sets a value that determines whether values in the column are required.
member.remarks: By default, this property is set to null, which means values are required, but string columns may contain empty strings. When set to true, values are required and empty strings are not allowed. When set to false, null values and empty strings are allowed.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.ColumnBaseBuilder`2.Width(System.String)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets the width of this column.
member.remarks: Column widths may be positive numbers (column width in pixels), null or negative numbers (use the collection's default column width), or strings in the format '{number}*' (star sizing).

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.ColumnBaseBuilder`2.DropDownCssClass(System.String)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets a CSS class name to add to drop-downs in this column.
member.remarks: The drop-down buttons are shown only if the column has a DataMap set and is editable. Clicking on the drop-down buttons causes the grid to show a list where users can select the value for the cell. Cell drop-downs require the wijmo.input module to be loaded.

member.name: M:C1.Web.Mvc.Fluent.ErrorBarBuilder`1.Value(System.Object)
member.summary: Configurates . Sets a value that specifies the error value of the series. This property should be work with ErrorAmount property. If ErrorAmount is ErrorAmount.FixedValue, the Value property is a fixed number value. If ErrorAmount is ErrorAmount.Percentage, the Value property is a percentage number value between 0 and 1. If errorAmount is ErrorAmount.Custom, the Value property is an object of minus/plus value or an array of minus/plus value. If ErrorAmount is ErrorAmount.StandardDeviation, the Value property is a percentage number of calculated standard deviation value.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Mvc.AnimationMode
member.summary: Specifies the animation mode whether chart should animate one point at a time, series by series, or all at once.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.AnimationMode.All
member.summary: All points and series are animated at once.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.AnimationMode.Point
member.summary: Animation is performed point by point. Multiple series are animated simultaneously at the same time.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.AnimationMode.Series
member.summary: Animation is performed series by series. Entire series is animated at once, following the same animation as the "All" option, but just one series at a time.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.ChartType
member.summary: Specifies which type of chart users want to create.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.ChartType.Column
member.summary: Column charts show vertical bars and allow you to compare values of items across categories.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.ChartType.Bar
member.summary: Bar charts show horizontal bars.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.ChartType.Scatter
member.summary: Scatter charts use X and Y coordinates to show patterns within the data.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.ChartType.Line
member.summary: Line charts show trends over a period of time or across categories.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.ChartType.LineSymbols
member.summary: Line and symbol charts are line charts with a symbol on each data point.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.ChartType.Area
member.summary: Area charts are line charts with the area below the line filled with color.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.ChartType.Bubble
member.summary: Bubble charts are Scatter charts with a third data value that determines the size of the symbol.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.ChartType.Candlestick
member.summary: Candlestick charts present items with high, low, open, and close values. The size of the wick line is determined by the High and Low values, while the size of the bar is determined by the Open and Close values. The bar is displayed using different colors, depending on whether the close value is higher or lower than the open value.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.ChartType.HighLowOpenClose
member.summary: High-low-open-close charts display the same information as a candlestick chart, except that opening values are displayed using lines to the left, while lines to the right indicate closing values.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.ChartType.Spline
member.summary: Spline charts are line charts that plot curves rather than angled lines through the data points.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.ChartType.SplineSymbols
member.summary: Spline and symbol charts are spline charts with symbols on each data point.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.ChartType.SplineArea
member.summary: Spline area charts are spline charts with the area below the line filled with color.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.ChartType.Funnel
member.summary: Displays funnel chart.

member.name: T:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.LineMarkerInteraction

member.summary: Specifies whether and where the Series is visible.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.TrendLineFitType.Linear
member.summary: A straight line that most closely approximates the data. Y(x) = a * x + b.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.TrendLineFitType.Exponential
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = a * exp(b*x).

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.TrendLineFitType.Logarithmic
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = a * ln(x) + b.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.TrendLineFitType.Power
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = a * pow(x, b).

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.TrendLineFitType.Fourier
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = a + b * cos(x) + c * sin(x) + d * cos(2*x) + e * sin(2*x) + ...

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.TrendLineFitType.Polynomial
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = a * x^n + b * x^n-1 + c * x^n-2 + ... + z.

member.summary: The minimum X-value.

member.summary: The minimum Y-value.

member.summary: The maximum X-value.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.TrendLineFitType.MaxY
member.summary: The maximum Y-value.

member.summary: The average X-value.

member.name: F:C1.Web.Mvc.Chart.TrendLineFitType.AverageY
member.summary: The average Y-value.

member.name: P:C1.JsonNet.JsonSetting.SkipIsDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicates how to serialize or deserialize the default value. If True, the default value will not be serialized or deserialized. Otherwise, it will be serialized or deserialized.

member.name: P:C1.JsonNet.JsonSetting.IsJavascriptFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicates whether to serialize to javascript format.
member.remarks: If some property type is string in server side, but its type is Function in client side, when IsJavascriptFormat is set to true, it will be serialzed to a string without quote. For example, the value of property A is "btnClick", it will be serialized to "{a: btnClick}". Otherwise, it will be serialized to "{a: 'btnClick'}". Normally when the page is loaded in the first time and the properties are transfered to the client side, this property should be set to True. For callback, it will be set to false.

member.name: P:C1.JsonNet.JsonSetting.SkipReferenceLoop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicates how reference loop is handled.
member.remarks: The object may has reference loop (e.g. a class referencing itself). The default is true which means does not serialize the member if it cause a reference loop.
